It does however bring movies to a whole new level of 3D. Fun to watch and show to other people.

This level of quality animation is what I expect to see coming in 2018 across both Oculus and Vive.. hopefully. This is just a 5 minute short video basically but it looks great! If VR game developers would put this type of effort into full length games we'd really have something special to play.

review_title: Enjoy with a Small Bag of Popcorn
one_reviews_text: Cutest short story ever!  I love these short stories in VR.  Keep em coming as I'm looking forward to more please.

review_title: Fun but it is just not working for VR
one_reviews_text:
To start with, graphics and animations are just fine; the issue is purely because story telling in VR is hard, and that is the reason why you don't see movies made in first person that much at the theater, and even less in VR.
Coco did great because it is interactive, so you can decide where to be and watch what is going on, but if you keep viewers stuck in a place in the scene, and just watch what is going on, that get boring after a while. Not even kids did hold enough attention to follow the whole thing, and were more interested in looking around instead than looking at the story.

Good start, well done on the technical side, but as experience; it is not involving enough and the VR is mostly a gimmik add for fun, more than for a useful purpose.

Excellent pro CGI animated film in VR.  This is a look into what we can expect from likely all animated trailers, and soon full features themselves, going forward.

Personally, I can't wait to watch a 5-star full animated movie through VR, and the shorts that I have watched (like "Henry") have been great examples of what to expect in the near future for movies.

Great job guys and thank you for this FREE experience!

review_title: This is fun - but just a movie
one_reviews_text: I liked this, cute animations, nice little story. You cannot move or interact but just sit back and enjoy
I don't like it as much as Henry, but it's still good. The FoV feel mighty small given the scale of the environment. Still, fun to watch.
There is nothing interactive about this. You are simply watching a movie trailer.

I really enjoyed it. A cute little short, was nice to experience in vr. The only downside for me was that i spent a bit of time looking in the wrong direction at the other bunny and missed some of the action i should have been looking at, but it was still enjoyable. Thanks.
It's really short, less than 5 minutes ... And not very impressive.  If you want an immersive experience, don't stop here
This was so cute!!!
It's free and the animation looks great, but over all the experience in 2017 almost 2018 isn't all the special. The lack of hands and interations make it a glorified 360 video.

review_title: Too short for its own good
one_reviews_text: Amazing, well crafted environment but it falls flat when it comes to what's actually happening on the screen. It's very short and not very funny (for me). Definitely good enough to impress your kids though.
As the subject suggests, its very short - yet, very nice demonstration of what will come
It is very nice short. I enjoyed it.
...kids'll love it.

review_title: Funny, cute, nice intro to VR
one_reviews_text: It's a great short VR animation film. It's so short they decided to ruin it a little by adding a somewhat expensive introduction and conclusion (when I say expensive, I am referring to the hiring of Ethan Hawke for the narrator's voice) to make it feel "fuller"... But I actually think it kills half of the fun. The first time I had tried this short movie, I started directly on the frozen lake, and was slowly introduced to the other characters. It made everything works way better. The intro kinda ruins one of the scene afterwards. 1st time I "played" it, I wasn't quite sure what was happening, and the way you find out with the eagle coming back was hilarious. Nice emotion then. Now it doesn't work as much, since you're warned from the start about the evilness of some characters. Nitpicking I guess, but to me it feels like a big mistake! Anyway, it's still enjoyable and very nice introduction to anyone new to VR.

...and VR movies. I just wish the viewers` position wouldn´t be fixed but moved around. Like sitting on a flying cinema chair and watching from different positions. Many scenes could be so much more intense (imagine how filmmakers could depict the Death Star; horror movies; car races...).
Short but funny.
This was a funny, cute, and interesting short film in VR.
It's a nice, short story.  Very well animated and full 360 crisp visuals.  But definitely geared towards kids.  Not enough time to feel invested in the characters.
Awesome, beautifull.. well, need next episode ? :p
Don`t mess with the wabbit......

The "Invasion!" experience is both family-dinner inviting and mob scene invigorating. It’s highly engaging by building dynamic characters and beautiful imagery that's easy to navigate.  The sound effects, music and visual flashes guide the viewer's attention in a smooth and comfortable manner. There’s so much to see that you become immersed and want to look everywhere.

Whenever I felt my attention had drifted from the action, their techniques brought me right back to where the main story was happening.  I felt both safe and wonderfully overwhelmed all at the same time.

review_title: not as good as LOST, but good!
one_reviews_text:

Far too short, but it`s early yet!

Like most 360-videos. This video also makes me wish I was anywhere other than the chosen viewport. After the initial interaction between me as a viewer and the bunny all of the action is moved a long way away. And the experience continues "over there". Why is it that whenever new storytelling tools come along (sound, color, scope, 3D, etc) the first thing that happens is that the camera gets locked down and the narrative transformes into a stageplay? Just get the evolution over with. Move the camera. Or at least pick viewports that are interesting... And don't be afraid to cut. For me cuts don't break immersion. Dead-time is the great immersion breaker.
and it makes a decent demo for guests.
Marred by the addition of a long introduction. The original (shorter) cut was better. Still worth the download as a demo for what VR can add to storytelling.
Nothing says VR like having a 6 foot rabbit looking over your shoulder.
